title: The Scarlet Swordsman
opening: Having liberated Grust, Marth and his companions accepted Wendell's request and stopped by the Fane of Raman in search of the missing orbs. However, the ancient temple built to worship Naga had been wrecked by constant warring, and was now nothing more than a den of thieves.

"They're escaping with the temple's valuable treasures. We must catch them! Stay clear of the free company guarding Chiasmir Bridge. We cannot defeat them. It seems a dancer is lost inside the forest. We must find her before the bandits do!"
As the soldiers received their orders, the flames of a new battle around the Fane of Raman were ignited.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: By the way, Kris. I have something I'd like to ask you.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Yes, Sir Jagen?

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: From your perspective, what kind of person am I?

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: What kind... of person?

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: I keep wondering about how I should have acted towards Lang... Our homeland Altea's position is important, but perhaps I brood far too much and offend people.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: You worry about these things too, Sir Jagen? You needn't worry. Your concern for Prince Marth is more than evident. You're very strict, Sir Jagen, but also very kind.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Is that so...? Ho ho, if you cheer me on enough, I may even age backwards!

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Sir Jagen, when you look at me, what kind of person do you see?

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Hmm, well... You're very capable as a Royal Guard...

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: And you have an aura that attracts people.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: And you're wise, almost foresighted.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: And I can feel a hidden genius somewhere.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: And you have a kind heart.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: And you have an indisputably strong heart.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: That's the kind of person you are.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: What an honor.

intro.speaker: Jagen
intro.line: Well, we'd best begin the war council. Let us go, Kris.

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Yes, Sir Jagen.

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: Huff... huff... Please... help me... The thieves... They're going to...

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: No, it can't be! You're... one of them... as well? Oh, fine... Do your worst! If you're going to kill me, do it fast!!

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: Girl... Get behind me. The Altean army is marching towards the south of this forest. I'll take you to them.

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: Huh? You're going to help me? You mean, you're not with the thieves?

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: Until just now, I was. But, I've changed my mind.

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: Why...?

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: There's someone in the Altean army that I want to see. That's all.

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: Hmmm... But really, it's 'cause I'm cute, right? At any rate, I'm glad. My name's Phina. I'm a dancer from Warren. People say that once they see my dancing, they feel instantly refreshed! I can show you, if you like. Oh, I should tell you my story: I got separated from my troupe, and wandered into this forest. And then, those horrible thieves came and tried to take me by force... But it's okay now. You seem kind of scary, but actually you're very kind. However, your appearance is... Your face isn't bad, but your dress sense is kind of lacking. And, ugh, what's with your hair? You know, nowadays...

intro.speaker: Navarre
intro.line: Just stop talking! Anyway, don't stray too far. We'll cut our way to the west corner, and then escape through there. If you want to live, then shut up and come with me.

intro.speaker: Phina
intro.line: Ah... Y-yes, sorry...

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: The ancient Fane of Raman is just a treasure trove to thieves. You can see 'em carrying the stolen treasure all over the place. I hope they get cursed or something...

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: The ones protecting the bridge are Astram's free company: powerful men who stop at nothing. As a wise man once said: "Let sleeping dogs lie", eh?

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: I wonder if you've seen that young lady's dance? Marvelous, isn't it? Makes a tired body feel healthy again in the blink of an eye!

visit.speaker: Villager
visit.line: You must never go near that cave. I heard a rumor that in that cave dwells a terrible fire dragon.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Captain Astram, we've sighted the Altean army to the south! Shall we attack?

battle.speaker: Astram
battle.line: Our mission is to hold the bridge. Leaving the bridge will not be permitted. Only attack if the enemy approaches.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Yes sir. But what about the troops in the fort? I hear they will march out soon.

battle.speaker: Astram
battle.line: They were bought with coin by the Emperor. Let them do as they please. Either way, they won't win. WE will be the ones to stop the Altean army.

battle.speaker: Jagen
battle.line: Sire, please exercise caution! Reports indicate that a fire dragon has emerged from the cave to the west!

recruit-battle.speaker: Astram
recruit-battle.line: Traitors! I'll show you the might of the Mercurius!

boss.speaker: Dahl
boss.line: Tryin' to take a cut from a thief's plunderin'... You people ain't even human!

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Sire, we've driven away the thieves, but the temple was completely ransacked; anything that wasn't nailed down is gone. I'm sure even Guardian Deity Naga would be furious. 'Tis truly the end of civilzation.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Jagen, do you know the legend of Naga?

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Yes; only vaguely, however. Kris, do you know of it?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: No, not really...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Unknown among the youth, I see... Then, sire, allow me the honor.

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: It's said that a thousand years ago... when there was not one king in the lands, people lived in small villages. One day, terrible monsters descended and the humans were massacred, pushed to the brink of extinction. The few who survived prayed to the gods for salvation. The gods heard their prayers, and a gigantic warrior was sent down to earth. The warrior carried a gleaming blade of light in his right hand, and in his left hand, a shield embedded with five orbs. Then, after a fierce battle, he eradicated the monsters and returned to the heavens. He was our guardian deity, Naga, and this temple is dedicated to him. "He was the avatar of the gods: our guardian deity..."

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: With the blade of light and the five orbs... That is the legend of Naga...

end.speaker: Jagen
end.line: Well then, sire. We have to cross the Chiasmir Bridge soon. We must hurry; if the enemy takes it, getting across will be nigh impossible.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Alright then, inform the whole army: We cross Chiasmir Bridge at once. We haven't a moment to waste!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes sir!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Lord Wendell, we're off to Chiasmir Bridge. I... A-achoo!

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Oh dear, are you alright? Have you caught a cold?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Perhaps. It's too early to tell.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Don't push yourself too hard, and remember to keep yourself warm. Oh I know, shall I lend you one of the hats that I'm wearing?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Huh? Is that okay?

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: Yes, I have many of these hats, so there's no need to worry. Well then, would you like to try it on?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Yes, please, if it's not a bother.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: No, no, don't be shy. Here you go. And do remember to watch your health.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: You're a good person, Lord Wendell. I want to be more like you... Oh yeah, if I wear this hat for a while, I wonder if my hair will start to look like his? And then, maybe I'll be a bit more like Lord Wendell!

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: No thank you, but I appreciate the gesture. I'll be just fine.

end.speaker: Wendell
end.line: I understand. But, do remember to watch your health.
